Sentencas: Highly active cathode materials are crucial to accelerating the commercialization of intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells (IT-SOFCs).
Titulo: Addressing the origin of highly catalytic activity of A-site Sr-doped perovskite cathodes for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Herein, Sr-doped Pr0.94Ba1-xSrxCo2O5+delta (PBSxCO) perovskite oxides are evaluated by experimental and theoretical studies.
Titulo: Addressing the origin of highly catalytic activity of A-site Sr-doped perovskite cathodes for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The phase transformation from tetragonal layered double perovskite to cubic simple perovskite can be identified with increasing the Sr fraction.
Titulo: Addressing the origin of highly catalytic activity of A-site Sr-doped perovskite cathodes for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Benefiting from enhanced electrical conductivity and oxygen surface rate, the PBSxCO catalysts deliver excellent electrochemical performance, as evidenced by symmetrical and completed cells test.
Titulo: Addressing the origin of highly catalytic activity of A-site Sr-doped perovskite cathodes for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Among all compositions, the Pr0.94Ba0.7Sr0.3Co2O5+delta (PBS0.3C0) cathode has the lowest polarization resistance (R-p) of 0.031 Omega cm(2) at 700 degrees C.
Titulo: Addressing the origin of highly catalytic activity of A-site Sr-doped perovskite cathodes for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The PBS0.3C0 cathode-based fuel cell produces a peak power density of 1077 mW cm(-2), along with a steady operating for 130 h at 700 degrees C. From the density functional theoretical (DFT) calculations, it is discovered that stronger Co 3d-O 2p hybridization is recognized in the Sr substituting model compared with undoped one.
Titulo: Addressing the origin of highly catalytic activity of A-site Sr-doped perovskite cathodes for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Furthermore, the decreased free energy for oxygen adsorption may facilitate the oxygen reduction reaction (ORR) kinetics.
Titulo: Addressing the origin of highly catalytic activity of A-site Sr-doped perovskite cathodes for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: These findings highlight the origin of optimal ORR activity induced by A-site alkaline earth doping in the perovskite catalysts, endowing the rational design of oxide catalysts.
Titulo: Addressing the origin of highly catalytic activity of A-site Sr-doped perovskite cathodes for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells
